n  the  case  of  Maduluwawe  Sobitha  Thero  vs  Joslin  and  Others  [2005]  3
(1)  Section  48(3)  of  the  Partition  Law  overrides  section  44  of  the  Evidence
Ordinance; accordingly, even a judgment obtained by fraud or collusion would
have the final and conclusive effect provided by section 48(1). Held further:
(2) It is to be noted that the plaintiff-respondent failed to disclose the name of
the  petitioner  who  has  title  to  the  entire  land.  The  failure  to  make  a  correct
declaration  under  section  12(1)  of  the  Partition  Law  amounts  to  a  procedural
irregularity which results in a miscarriage of justice.
